paragraphs.text:
Who We Are  
TechNova International – a global tech giant based in San Francisco, operating in 38 countries with 72,000 employees. We deal in cloud computing, AI, and digital infrastructure, raking in $24.6B in revenue last year. Listed on NYSE, part of Dow Jones Sustainability Index, FTSE4Good, etc.

Big Wins This Year  
- Emissions Down: Cut Scope 1 & 2 GHG emissions by 17% (now at 410,000 metric tons CO2e). Scope 3 dropped 6% (1.85M metric tons).  
- Renewables: 61% of global electricity now renewable (up from 47%). Some facilities in the U.S., Germany, and Japan hit 100%.  
- Diversity Boost: Workforce now 43% women, 29% underrepresented minorities (+8% YoY). Leadership roles improving—38% women managers, 24% women execs. Board? 45% women, 36% diverse ethnic reps.  
- Waste & Water: 74% of operational waste diverted from landfills. Water use down 9% (2.8M cubic meters).

Social Stuff  
- Employees: Dropped $62M on training (avg. 42 hours/employee). Engagement score hit 81% (up 3 points). 68% work hybrid/remote.  
- Safety: Injury rate 0.23 per 100 FTEs (15% improvement).  
- Community: Reached 1.2M people via nonprofits, 420K through digital inclusion programs. Employees volunteered 138K hours.  
- Supply Chain: 97% of Tier 1 suppliers vetted for human rights. Supplier diversity spend up 21% with women/minority-owned businesses.

Governance  
- Board: 11 members—45% women, 36% diverse. Met 11 times (98% attendance).  
- Pay Tied to ESG: 22% of exec bonuses linked to sustainability goals.  
- Ethics: 100% employees, 96% suppliers did ethics training. Whistleblower hotline got 138 reports—17 disciplinary actions, 4 firings.  
- Cybersecurity: Spent $136M, zero major breaches. ISO 27001 certified across all major data centers.

Challenges & What’s Next  
- Scope 3 emissions still a beast—targeting 30% cut by 2030.  
- Net-zero by 2040 remains the moonshot.  
- Circular economy push: More recycled materials in products, scale take-back programs.  
- Digital inclusion: Aiming for 2M beneficiaries by 2027.  
- Transparency: More third-party audits, aligning with UN SDGs, TCFD, etc.

Final Thoughts  
Tech’s a tool for good—if we do it right. Grateful for stakeholder trust. Onward to less carbon, more inclusion, and fewer PowerPoints next year.
(Same content, less corporate-speak. Data intact, just shuffled.)
